constituent: waiter, person, Buddhist temple, soil, dirt, ground, glue
heisigStory: Person . . . Buddhist temple. The key word is deceptively modern, but the kanji is actually another way of writing "samurai." Be careful not to confuse with attend (Frame 1033).
koohiiStory1: Mr. T infiltrates the secret samurai Buddhist temple as a waiter with a tray of green tea. (Careful: attend (#960)).
koohiiStory2: Remember the kanji for wait, 待. Well, now we have a waiter, and he´s dropped a dish. See: 侍! 待 crash 侍.
myStory: chữ thị. hầu. nội thị, thị nữ. người ở trong chùa là người hầu. nhân + tự
